TITLE: International astronaut will be invited on future NASA moon landing
SUMMARY: “We know from experience that collaboration on space delivers,” said Secretary of State Antony Blinken

TITLE: To protect an endangered owl species, government biologists propose killing off other owls
SUMMARY: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service is proposing to shoot 470,000 barred owls in West Coast forests over 30 years because the birds are crowding out the region’s native spotted owls

TITLE: Alabama plans to execute a man using nitrogen gas. How will it work? Few know.
SUMMARY: Kenneth Eugene Smith, convicted in a 1988 murder-for-hire plot, could become the first death row inmate put to death by nitrogen hypoxia in the U.S

TITLE: Great Lakes see little ice as warmer temperatures persist
SUMMARY: Ice covered less than 0.4% of the Great Lakes on New Year’s Day, though it's not unprecedented for little ice to have formed early in the winter season

TITLE: First U.S. lunar lander in more than 50 years rockets toward the moon — but suffers early glitch
SUMMARY: The Peregrine spacecraft should attempt a moon landing Feb. 23, but had to perform an "improvised maneuver" to charge its battery

TITLE: First commercial mission to the moon is set for launch, space burials included
SUMMARY: The “Peregrine” lander, developed by a Pittsburgh-based company called Astrobotic, is scheduled to launch into space on Monday

TITLE: Scientists find about a quarter-million invisible nanoplastic particles in a liter of bottled water
SUMMARY: Researchers still can’t answer the big question: Are those nanoplastic pieces harmful to health

TITLE: NASA delays Artemis moon missions
SUMMARY: The space agency said it’s now targeting September 2025 for its crewed missions around the moon, which had been scheduled for later this year

TITLE: Private mission to the moon won't land on lunar surface after malfunction
SUMMARY: “Given the propellant leak, there is, unfortunately, no chance of a soft landing on the moon,” Astrobotic Technology said

TITLE: Good news, bad news: U.S. emissions shrank last year, but very slowly
SUMMARY: Greenhouse gas emissions fell by about 1.9% in 2023 as the economy grew, according to a preliminary analysis from the Rhodium Group, which tracks the U.S. progress toward its climate goals and provides yearly reports

TITLE: The U.S. is missing a ton of snow — even with recent storms
SUMMARY: Snow monitoring stations show more than 90% are below the median for this time of year, and new research points to climate change as the reason for declines in crucial snowpacks

TITLE: What killed the 'real King Kong'? Scientists say they now know the answer to an ancient mystery
SUMMARY: The giant apes made the "fatal mistake" of failing to adapt their strict diet, one of the study’s lead researchers told NBC News

TITLE: The Amazon's ancient complex of 'lost cities' flourished for a thousand years
SUMMARY: New laser mapping technology revealed intricate networks of roads, neighborhoods and gardens as complex as those built by the Mayan civilization

TITLE: Fossilized, crocodile-like skin is oldest ever discovered, scientists say
SUMMARY: The skin, which is at least 286 million years old, was found at a quarry and cave system called Richards Spur. Researchers think animals fell into the cave system and were preserved by oil that seeped in, encasing them.&nbsp

TITLE: As the new Covid variant surges in the U.S., what to know about testing and accuracy
SUMMARY: Do we need to keep swabbing our nasal passages with Covid tests at the first sign of congestion or achiness? How well do at-home rapid tests work against the JN.1 variant

TITLE: NOAA and the terrible, horrible, no good, very hot year
SUMMARY: The government agency confirmed that 2023 was the hottest year on record, adding to other troubling climate superlatives including record ocean heat and record low Antarctic sea ice

TITLE: On YouTube, climate denialism takes a turn
SUMMARY: A study of more than 12,000 videos found that efforts to discredit the climate movement have moved on from whether climate change is real to focus on skepticism of solutions, activists and scientists

TITLE: The more scientists study Greenland, the worse its ice melt looks
SUMMARY: A new study found that the loss of ice has been underestimated, adding to a recent string of research that has drawn attention to rapid change in Greenland.&nbsp

TITLE: Japan counts down to precision 'moon sniper' landing mission
SUMMARY: Japan is increasingly looking to play a bigger role in space, partnering with Washington to respond to China’s military and technological might

TITLE: Astronauts from Turkey, Sweden and Italy launch to space station on latest chartered flight
SUMMARY: The astronauts should reach the International Space Station on Saturday and will spend two weeks at the orbiting outpost

TITLE: Peregrine, aiming to be first private lunar lander, burns up in Earth's atmosphere
SUMMARY: An early malfunction left the Peregrine lander with no way to reach the moon

TITLE: Emperor penguins are leaving poo stains that are visible from space. It's a good thing.
SUMMARY: Scientists warn that the long-term outlook remains grim for the flightless birds, whose ice-sheet breeding grounds are being melted by climate change

TITLE: 'Wake up': Senate hearing considers threat of climate change on 'blue economy'
SUMMARY: The consequences of global warming are already hitting some industries that rely on waterways and ports

TITLE: NASA’s little helicopter on Mars has logged its last flight
SUMMARY: Originally intended as a short-term tech demo, Ingenuity logged 72 flights over three years. It accumulated more than two hours of flight time, traveling 11 miles. That’s more than 14 times farther than planned

TITLE: Japan's moon probe nailed its landing but took a tumble
SUMMARY: The mission achieved its goal of a precision landing within 100 meters of its target but appears to have overturned in the process

TITLE: Congress wants to ban China's largest genomics firm from doing business in the U.S. Here's why.
SUMMARY: Intel officials have warned China is grabbing U.S. genetic info that could be used to create targeted bioweapons that would work against one group and not another

TITLE: A prestigious cancer institute is rocked by allegations of sloppy science in dozens of papers
SUMMARY: The criticism spotlights how artificial intelligence is playing a growing role in catching sloppy or dubious science. &nbsp

TITLE: Writing by hand may increase brain connectivity more than typing, study finds
SUMMARY: After recording the brain activity of university students, researchers in Norway determined that writing by hand may improve learning and memory

TITLE: Western monarch butterfly numbers in California dropped by 30% last year, researchers say
SUMMARY: Even though the butterflies have been bouncing back, the insect populations are still well below what they were in the 1980s, when monarchs numbered in the millions

TITLE: Behind Elon Musk's brain chip: Decades of research and lofty ambitions to meld minds with computers
SUMMARY: Many scientists applauded Neuralink’s announcement, while also cautiously noting not much information has been released publicly

TITLE: The Earth's tectonic plates made the Himalayas — and could rip them apart
SUMMARY: Researchers theorize that the Indian plate is plunging under the Eurasian plate, but as that process plays out, part of it is splitting apart under Tibet

TITLE: Sea sponges keep climate records and the accounting is grim, study shows
SUMMARY: A study of the temperature-sensitive sea creatures makes the case that the world has warmed more than previously thought, though some scientists are skeptical

TITLE: Police investigating package containing 2 preserved fetuses sent to Philadelphia science museum
SUMMARY: A letter in the package said a retired physician was donating the specimens to the Mütter Museum. No other information was provided

TITLE: Category 6? Climate-boosted hurricanes push scientists to rethink classifications
SUMMARY: The findings add to ongoing debates about how to better communicate to the public the threats of extreme weather events and the ways that climate change can multiply them

TITLE: Robotic device burned a woman's small intestine during surgery, lawsuit alleges
SUMMARY: Similar issues with Intuitive Surgical's robot go back more than a decade, according to a lawsuit the woman's husband filed in Florida

TITLE: Astronauts from Turkey, Italy and Sweden return to Earth, ending private space station trip
SUMMARY: The trio enjoyed a few extra days at the space station, waiting for the weather to improve in the splashdown zone

TITLE: NASA climate satellite blasts off to survey oceans and atmosphere of a warming Earth
SUMMARY: SpaceX launched the Pace satellite on its $948 million mission before dawn, with the Falcon rocket heading south over the Atlantic to achieve a rare polar orbit

TITLE: Ed Dwight, who was to be the first Black astronaut, is finally getting his due
SUMMARY: The new documentary “The Space Race,” chronicles the stories of Black astronauts — and their first pioneer, 90-year-old Ed Dwight

TITLE: Wisconsin's first recorded February tornado hits south of capital
SUMMARY: High temperatures were about 25 degrees Fahrenheit warmer than usual on Thursday in parts of Wisconsin. Tornado records date back to 1948

TITLE: Nukes in space or nothing new? The science behind the intel frenzy over a Russian weapon
SUMMARY: Russia is developing a nuclear space-based weapon designed to target American satellites, three sources familiar with the matter told NBC News

TITLE: NASA's final tally shows spacecraft returned double the amount of asteroid rubble
SUMMARY: The black, carbon-rich samples — the first ever collected from an asteroid by NASA — are stored at a special curation lab at Houston’s Johnson Space Center

TITLE: Google to share oil and gas methane leaks spotted from space
SUMMARY: Working with the Environmental Defense Fund, Google will help pinpoint and map methane emissions with a focus on oil and gas infrastructure

TITLE: Historic California palm trees come crashing down into ocean amid powerful winter storms
SUMMARY: Los Angeles has seen 75% of its annual average rainfall in just the first three weeks of February

TITLE: Black hole devouring a sun a day may be universe's brightest object
SUMMARY: The quasar swirls like a cosmic hurricane and is described by Australian researcher Christian Wolf as "the most violent place that we know in the universe

TITLE: A satellite will make a fiery fall back to Earth, European Space Agency says
SUMMARY: The defunct satellite will make an uncontrolled return to Earth, but the agency said that most of it should burn up in the atmosphere

TITLE: Privately built lunar lander aims to be first to touch down on moon
SUMMARY: The Odysseus is scheduled to land near the moon's south pole on Thursday in a major step for private space exploration

TITLE: Moon landing live updates: Odysseus completes first U.S. lunar landing since 1972
SUMMARY: The landing attempt will be livestreamed on NASA TV beginning at 3 p.m. ET

TITLE: Parts of California are crumbling toward the ocean — here's why
SUMMARY: Palm trees are falling, and multimillion-dollar homes are teetering. The state's turbulent weather is only growing more extreme thanks to climate change

TITLE: Astronomers spot new tiny moons around Neptune and Uranus
SUMMARY: The latest tally puts Neptune at 16 known moons and Uranus at 28

TITLE: Private lunar lander sends back first pics from its moon landing
SUMMARY: The Odysseus lander, built by Houston-based Intuitive Machines, touched down and tipped over but continues to operate

TITLE: Stingray's virgin pregnancy may have a delightfully unusual scientific explanation
SUMMARY: Scientists think the pregnancy of Charlotte, a stingray living in a tank without any male rays, is an example of parthenogenesis, a miracle of life more common than most people think

TITLE: Timing of Texas weather patterns was 'the worst possible' for spread of wildfires
SUMMARY: One climatologist called the situation "like a hurricane making landfall at high tide." Fires raced across the landscape so quickly that firefighters had little chance to contain them.&nbsp

TITLE: Our ancient animal ancestors had tails. Why don’t we?
SUMMARY: Researchers have identified at least one of the key genetic tweaks that led to the change

TITLE: Humpback whales photographed having sex — and gay sex — for the first time
SUMMARY: The sexual encounter, which occurred in waters west of the Hawaiian island of Maui in January 2022, was detailed in a new report

TITLE: Mexico City's 21 million residents are facing a severe water shortage
SUMMARY: Local authorities have imposed water rations as reservoirs hit historic low levels. Some residents said they're going to extreme lengths to conserve the little they have

TITLE: Hatch watch: Bald eagle chicks expected to emerge on livestream from Southern California mountains
SUMMARY: Activity at the nest is being closely monitored, with a nonprofit group providing live updates, that include vocalizations from the birds of prey, as well as daily recaps

TITLE: This L.A. neighborhood's 'cool pavements' help it beat the intense heat
SUMMARY: A solar-reflective coating used in the community of Pacoima could be a playbook to offer relief to other incredibly warm — and often working-class — California neighborhoods

TITLE: SpaceX and NASA successfully launch manned Crew-8 mission to International Space Station
SUMMARY: The crew, set to return in the fall, will spend 6 months at the ISS

TITLE: Florida Senate passes bill blocking local rules protecting workers from heat
SUMMARY: The legislation comes after the planet notched its hottest year in recorded history in 2023

TITLE: Wildfire seasons are starting earlier and getting longer
SUMMARY: Blazes in western Canada and Texas highlight how the elements that fuel wildfires are becoming present earlier in the year. Scientists say climate change is a factor

TITLE: No evidence that U.S. covered up existence of UFOs, Pentagon report says
SUMMARY: "Investigative efforts determined that most sightings were the result of misidentification of ordinary objects and phenomena," according to Pentagon review

TITLE: A lack of ice is reshaping winter life around the Great Lakes
SUMMARY: The lack of snow and lake ice has left some hearty Midwesterners who ski, skate and fish to question how their lifestyles will persist as the world warms

TITLE: Australia’s Great Barrier Reef hit by fifth mass bleaching event in eight years
SUMMARY: Bleaching does not necessarily kill coral reefs, but it can make them more susceptible to disease

TITLE: SpaceX prepares third test of Starship rocket
SUMMARY: The launch is scheduled for Thursday morning. The company hopes to test a variety of capabilities, including a controlled re-entry through Earth’s atmosphere

TITLE: Wildfires are becoming night owls — and that’s a big problem
SUMMARY: Droughts leading to dry vegetation are providing the fuel for wildfires to remain hot overnight, making them more destructive

TITLE: Playing with dogs helps people concentrate and relax, brain recordings show
SUMMARY: In a study of brain activity, walking a poodle made people more relaxed, brushing the dog improved concentration and playing with her had both effects

TITLE: Heat in one Arizona county played a role in 645 deaths last year
SUMMARY: Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix and many of its suburbs, was hit by a brutal heat wave last sumer

TITLE: SpaceX launches Starship rocket into orbit on test flight, but loses spacecraft during return to Earth
SUMMARY: In the rocket’s third and most ambitious test flight yet, it achieved two milestones: Starship successfully reached orbit and re-entered Earth’s atmosphere for the first time

TITLE: 12 months of record ocean heat has scientists puzzled and concerned
SUMMARY: The huge temperature anomaly — which climate change alone is unlikely to explain — could be a bad sign for hurricane season

TITLE: Miami's chief heat officer knows the challenges of a climate-focused job in Florida
SUMMARY: Jane Gilbert is working to figure out how one of the hottest cities in the U.S. can protect its most vulnerable denizens while navigating Florida politics

TITLE: Battered by hurricanes and tired of rebuilding, 90% of population has left this coastal town
SUMMARY: The consequences of climate change are already taking a toll on some U.S. communities. In Cameron, Louisiana, hope comes from a natural gas plant that activists call a "carbon bomb

TITLE: A 'devil comet' is set to swing by the sun and could be visible during the eclipse
SUMMARY: Comet 12P/Pons-Brooks was nicknamed the “devil comet” because an eruption last year left it with two distinct trails of gas and ice in the shape of devil horns

TITLE: Seven countries met the WHO's air quality guidelines — and the U.S. and Canada aren't among them
SUMMARY: More than 92% of the countries and regions analyzed exceeded guidelines for particulate pollution, according to a report from IQAir, a Swiss air quality-monitoring company

TITLE: Tennessee lawmakers vote to ban geoengineering, with allusions to 'chemtrails' conspiracy theory
SUMMARY: The bill would prohibit technologies that could modify the atmosphere. But lawmakers’ comments about it toed a line between fact and fiction

TITLE: Eclipse glasses: A look behind the scenes of how they're made
SUMMARY: Eclipse glasses are crucial for safely viewing the eclipse. Here's what to know about how they're made — and how to avoid fakes

TITLE: White House directs NASA to create a standard of time for the moon
SUMMARY: The differing gravitational force on the moon, and potentially other factors, change how time unfolds relative to how it is perceived on Earth

TITLE: Earthquake showed Taiwan was well prepared for a big one — more so than parts of U.S.
SUMMARY: Following a devastating earthquake in 1999, Taiwan upgraded its seismic infrastructure. Experts said it offers lessons for the U.S. West Coast

TITLE: NBC News prepares nationwide eclipse coverage
SUMMARY: On Monday, April 8, NBC News will feature extensive live coverage of the historic eclipse beginning at 2 p.m. ET. Lester Holt will anchor the two-hour special live from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, the world’s largest viewing site of the 2024 eclipse, and we’ll have correspondents stationed across the U.S. to track the cosmic event

TITLE: Early hurricane season forecast suggests extremely high number of storms
SUMMARY: “The highest April forecast that we have put out”: Researchers at Colorado State University anticipate 23 named storms this season. An average season has 14

TITLE: Growing demand for stronger marijuana highlights the risk of cannabis-induced psychiatric disorders
SUMMARY: As more states legalize recreational cannabis products, there’s been greater consumer demand for more powerful weed, raising the possible of risk of psychiatric disorders

TITLE: Mexico’s likely next president is a scientist. Politics has her mostly quiet on climate threats.
SUMMARY: Claudia Sheinbaum co-authored the Nobel-winning Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change report, but her political mentor, President López Obrador, has pushed fossil fuels

TITLE: Mercury exposure is widespread among Yanomami tribe in Amazon, a report finds
SUMMARY: Researchers collected samples from hundreds of Yanomani of all ages, and 84% had a level of exposure that can lead to health problems, and it's come from illegal gold mining

TITLE: Gadi Schwartz previews eclipse coverage in the sky
SUMMARY: Gadi Schwartz previews NBC News’ solar eclipse coverage up in the air over Texas

TITLE: Concerns about eye discomfort appear to rise after solar eclipse
SUMMARY: Worried about your eyes after Monday’s eclipse? Though cases of long-term damage have been reported after past eclipses, they’re rare

TITLE: When is the next total solar eclipse?
SUMMARY: If you missed Monday's solar eclipse or regret that you didn't travel to a spot in the path of totality, you can start planning for next time

TITLE: Prestigious cancer research institute has retracted 7 studies after allegations of altered images
SUMMARY: The episode has imperiled the reputation of the Harvard-affiliated Dana-Farber Cancer Institute and raised questions about the work of one high-profile researcher

TITLE: Peter Higgs, who proposed the existence of the 'God particle,' has died at 94
SUMMARY: His work helps scientists understand one of the most fundamental riddles of the universe: how the Big Bang created something out of nothing 13.8 billion years ago

TITLE: EPA imposes first national limits on 'forever chemicals' in drinking water
SUMMARY: PFAS are a class of chemicals that can linger almost permanently in air, water and soil. Research suggests they are associated with a variety of health issues, including cancer

TITLE: With New Jersey earthquake's fault still not found, researchers deploy new aftershock sensors
SUMMARY: The U.S. Geological Survey has already recorded at least 50 aftershocks since the 4.8-magnitude earthquake last week.&nbsp

TITLE: O.J. Simpson will be cremated, brain won't be donated for CTE research, lawyer says
SUMMARY: The executor, Malcolm LaVergne, who was Simpson's longtime lawyer, said he also wants to "tone down the rhetoric" with the Goldman family after Simpson's death

TITLE: World's coral reefs hit by a fourth mass bleaching event, NOAA says
SUMMARY: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said reefs are showing signs of stress brought on by ocean temperatures that have set daily records for more than a year

TITLE: Dubai clears up after epic rains swamp glitzy desert city
SUMMARY: The rains were the heaviest experienced by the Gulf state in the 75 years that records have been kept. They brought much of the country to a standstill and caused significant damage

TITLE: Tall flowers, dead shrubs, ephemeral lake: Death Valley has become a picture of climate whiplash
SUMMARY: After ping-ponging between severe drought and record rainfall, the famed California desert is offering up strange scenes

TITLE: Scientists push new paradigm of animal consciousness, saying even insects may be sentient
SUMMARY: Far more animals than previously thought likely have consciousness, top scientists say in a new declaration — including fish, lobsters and octopus

TITLE: Europe is the fastest-warming continent, at nearly twice the average rate, report says
SUMMARY: The latest 5-year averages show that temperatures in Europe are running 2.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, compared to 1.3 degrees higher globally

TITLE: Biden is marking Earth Day by announcing $7 billion in federal solar power grants
SUMMARY: Bidenis working to energize young voters for his re-election campaign

TITLE: New tools from NOAA and CDC show people their risk from heat as another hot summer looms
SUMMARY: The tools are part of a broader initiative to prepare the U.S. for extreme heat, following the planet's warmest year on record

TITLE: 131 million in U.S. live in areas with unhealthy pollution levels, lung association finds
SUMMARY: The report also found that people in the United States experienced more “very unhealthy” or “hazardous” air quality days than any time in the survey’s history.&nbsp

TITLE: Cicadas are so noisy in a South Carolina county that residents are calling the police
SUMMARY: Trillions of red-eyed periodical cicadas are emerging from underground in the eastern U.S. this month

TITLE: New EPA rules would force coal-fired power plants to capture emissions or shut down
SUMMARY: The rule was among four separate measures targeting coal and natural gas plants that the EPA said would provide “regular certainty” to the power industry and encourage them to make investments to transition “to a clean energy economy

TITLE: Democrats say Big Oil misled public for decades about climate change
SUMMARY: A new report released Tuesday details how oil companies knew the consequences of their emissions since at least the 1960s

TITLE: In a first, an orangutan was seen treating his wound with a medicinal plant
SUMMARY: After an orangutan hurt his face, scientists observed him chewing a plant known to relieve pain and applying a paste made from the leaves to the injury

TITLE: Face of a 75,000-year-old Neanderthal woman revealed by scientists
SUMMARY: The reconstructed face is closer than expected to a modern-day human’s, meaning it’s “perhaps easier to see how interbreeding occurred,” experts said

TITLE: Florida bans lab-grown meat, adding to similar efforts in three other states
SUMMARY: Companies that have made strides in cultivated meat technology said Florida’s law stifles innovation in a space that is becoming competitive globally

TITLE: After years of pandemic-related closures, Asia's students are going remote again
SUMMARY: Experts say rising temperatures and the resulting disruptions threaten to widen the learning gaps between developing and developed countries

TITLE: China launches Chang'e 6 lunar probe, revving up space race
SUMMARY: The first-of-its-kind mission aims to bring back samples from the far side of the moon and is the latest step in a rapidly advancing Chinese space program

TITLE: Los Angeles unleashes a new weapon in its fight against mosquitoes: More mosquitoes
SUMMARY: A mosquito species that targets humans has moved into Southern California. Officials are sending out lab-raised, irradiated mosquitoes in bid to fight them

TITLE: Vermont passes bill to charge fossil fuel companies for damage from climate change
SUMMARY: The legislation — the first of its kind in the U.S. — would require companies with high emissions to help pay for destruction caused by climate-fueled extreme weather

TITLE: Scientists document remarkable sperm whale 'phonetic alphabet'
SUMMARY: A new analysis of years of vocalizations by sperm whales in the eastern Caribbean has found that their system of communication is more sophisticated than previously known

TITLE: Canadian wildfires trigger air quality alerts across 4 U.S. states
SUMMARY: Winds have carried plumes of smoke over Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota and Minnesota

TITLE: Big banks still funnel hundreds of billions into the fossil fuel industry, report shows
SUMMARY: Activists have long sought to put pressure on the money that undergirds oil, gas and coal. But a report shows how global banks continue to finance fossil-fuel-related endeavors

TITLE: San Francisco poised to become first U.S. city to ban 'forever chemicals' in firefighter gear
SUMMARY: City lawmakers are set to vote Tuesday on a proposal to phase out fire gear manufactured with PFAS

TITLE: First crewed launch of Boeing's spacecraft is delayed yet again due to a new issue
SUMMARY: An issue with the capsule's rocket forced the launch to be postponed last week. But now, a new technical issue concerning the Starliner itself has forced another delay

TITLE: Mona Lisa's mysterious background decrypted by art-loving geologist
SUMMARY: “When I came to Lecco, I realized he had painted the 'Mona Lisa' here,” said Renaissance specialist Ann Pizzorusso

TITLE: Cities look for new ways to keep people safe — and alive — as extreme summer heat looms
SUMMARY: Preparations for severe heat waves have been underway for many months in parts of the country that were hit hard last year

TITLE: World's oceans have gone 'crazy haywire,' officials warn, with majority of coral reefs in peril
SUMMARY: Conditions last year were so unusually warm in some waters that heat stress levels were literally off the charts of NOAA's alert system

TITLE: New research could solve the mystery behind the construction of Egypt's pyramids
SUMMARY: Why are Egypt’s pyramids in a remote desert? New research says the Nile used to flow there

TITLE: Ed Dwight, America's first Black astronaut candidate, becomes oldest person to reach space
SUMMARY: Dwight was an Air Force pilot when President John F. Kennedy championed him as a candidate for NASA’s early astronaut corps

TITLE: Blood-sucking body lice may have spread plague more than thought, science suggests
SUMMARY: Lab experiments support the possibility that the blood-sucking bugs may have played a role in the rapid spread of the plague in the Middle Ages

TITLE: Hundreds of mountain goats were flown to a new home. Very few survived.
SUMMARY: After mountain goats were moved into Washington state's Cascade Mountains, most died within a few years — bringing scientists' attention to a broader threat to the species

TITLE: Turbulence-related deaths are rare, but climate change is making for bumpier air travel
SUMMARY: From 2009 to 2023, turbulence resulted in 185 serious injuries aboard commercial planes, but there were no turbulence-related deaths in the U.S. in that time, officials said

TITLE: Extreme heat hits Texas and Florida early in the season
SUMMARY: Miami's heat index has already smashed the previous record — and it's only May

TITLE: A helium leak in Boeing's spaceship will further delay its first flight with astronauts
SUMMARY: The Starliner's launch, previously scheduled for Saturday, is now on hold, with the next possible launch date still under discussion

TITLE: NOAA issues highest-ever early forecast for the coming hurricane season
SUMMARY: Agency forecasters predict an exceptionally busy year for storms, with eight to 13 hurricanes

TITLE: A vintage find: Man discovers mammoth bones in wine cellar
SUMMARY: “I thought it was just a piece of wood left by my grandfather,” said Andreas Pernerstorfer

TITLE: A potentially habitable Earth-size planet was discovered just 40 light-years away
SUMMARY: Dubbed Gliese 12 b, the planet takes 12.8 days to orbit a star that is 27% of the sun’s size

TITLE: What does a city that has spurned cars look like? Olympics visitors to Paris will get a look
SUMMARY: Changes designed to encourage people to take other forms of transportation have contributed to a 40% decline in air pollution, according to city officials

TITLE: Triple-digit temperatures to hit parts of California and Arizona in early-season heat wave
SUMMARY: Ahead of the heat, a grass fire took off near Tracy, California, and quickly grew to more than 14,000 acres, closing a highly used freeway

TITLE: Equipment failure on NASA's Hubble space telescope means fewer observations, officials say
SUMMARY: NASA said Tuesday that attempts to fix a malfunctioning gyroscope have failed, so Hubble will operate with just one gyroscope going forward, which will limit its scientific capability

TITLE: Controversial trial of technology that could be used to brighten clouds gets voted down in California
SUMMARY: The Bay Area city of Alameda has wound up at the center of a public debate over the promises and perils of geoengineering

TITLE: Boeing Starliner flies NASA astronauts into space for first time
SUMMARY: This is the first crewed flight of the company's Starliner capsule, which was developed in partnership with NASA to ferry astronauts to and from the International Space Station

TITLE: Earth is warming at a record rate, with 92% of last year's heat caused by humans, study finds
SUMMARY: The study shows that the rate Earth is warming hit an all-time high in 2023, though scientists did not find evidence that human-caused climate change is accelerating

TITLE: SpaceX successfully launches its Starship megarocket to orbit, returning it to Earth for the first time
SUMMARY: SpaceX's 400-foot rocket is the most powerful booster ever developed, and the system is expected to play an important role in NASA’s efforts to return astronauts to the moon

TITLE: June's tumbling heat records portend another summer of extremes
SUMMARY: “What’s more impressive is how much we beat the old records by,” the National Weather Service said of heat that hit Las Vegas

TITLE: NASCAR debuts electric race car prototype ahead of Chicago Street Race
SUMMARY: The vehicle's debut was part of the organization's long-term goals decarbonizing its operations and reducing its carbon footprint

TITLE: Discriminatory past shapes heat waves in communities of color
SUMMARY: Mortality records from cities across the country have shown that heat waves kill along socioeconomic and racial lines

TITLE: Too much solar? How California found itself with an unexpected energy challenge
SUMMARY: The state is, at times, producing more energy than it can use. That has led it to explore storage options and trim financial incentives

TITLE: Beryl is likely just the start of a 'hyperactive' hurricane season, forecaster say
SUMMARY: Colorado State University, a prominent hurricane and tropical weather forecast center, said it now expects six hurricanes of at least Category 3

TITLE: Four volunteers, 378 days: NASA completes first mission simulating astronaut life on Mars
SUMMARY: Kelly Haston, Ross Brockwell, Anca Selariu and Nathan Jones spent more than a year living in a 3D-printed habitat called the Mars Dune Alpha

TITLE: Montana Republicans urge state high court to reverse landmark youth climate ruling
SUMMARY: A lower court ruled last year that regulators must consider greenhouse gas emissions in approving oil, gas and coal projects

TITLE: New study finds lead and arsenic in tampons. Experts say don't panic.
SUMMARY: Recent research out of UC Berkeley found that many tampons on the market, including organic and nonorganic, may contain toxic metals, such as lead and arsenic

TITLE: How much heat can humans handle? It may be may be much lower than you think.
SUMMARY: Researchers have been racing to determine what kind of temperatures humans can survive in without air conditioning in a warming world

TITLE: Scientists have confirmed a cave on the moon that could be used to shelter future explorers
SUMMARY: The cave isn't far from where Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed 55 years ago. The moon may have hundreds more like it

TITLE: Melting ice is slowing Earth's rotation, shifting its axis and even influencing its core, study shows
SUMMARY: Two new studies suggest human behavior has changed foundational elements of the planet’s physical properties

TITLE: Near-complete Stegosaurus fossil sells for record $44 million at auction
SUMMARY: The skeleton, touted as one of the best-preserved of its kind ever found, was discovered on private land in Colorado in 2022

TITLE: What the 9 human cases of bird flu in the U.S. so far tell us about the disease
SUMMARY: The illnesses, all in farm workers, have been relatively mild — a contrast to the flu’s deadly effect on many birds and some mammals

TITLE: Four dead in a week: Heat leads to tragedies in state and national parks
SUMMARY: The parents of a 30-year-old woman found dead in a Utah state park are in critical condition from heat exhaustion. "They don’t know yet their daughter passed away," a friend said

TITLE: California fire outlook grows more worrisome after heat dries out tall grass fed by winter rain
SUMMARY: More than twice the usual acreage has burned in California for this time in the fire season

TITLE: Why a third of Hurricane Beryl deaths in Texas were due to heat
SUMMARY: Seven people died not as a result of the typical threats a storm brings, but instead because of extreme heat during the widespread power outages

TITLE: Despite sizable cuts to emissions, U.S. still far off track to hit its goals, report finds
SUMMARY: The U.S. aims to reduce emissions by at least 50% by 2030. But a new report estimates that the actual reduction will be less than that: 32% to 43

TITLE: Arizona officials warning about spread of potentially fatal hantavirus
SUMMARY: An increase in infections in the state may be due to seasonal changes in rodent populations

TITLE: Sunday was the hottest day ever recorded on Earth
SUMMARY: The average global temperature reached 17.09 degrees Celsius, or about 62.76 Fahrenheit, which is just above the record set last July

TITLE: Hydrothermal explosion at Yellowstone sends up geyser of rock and steam
SUMMARY: There were no injuries in the eruption near Old Faithful, but parts of Biscuit Basin are closed and damage assessments are underway

TITLE: Monday was the world's hottest day ever recorded — breaking Sunday's short-lived record
SUMMARY: Global temperature records have been broken twice in a row this week

TITLE: Smoke from wildfires in Canada and the West Coast spreads across North America
SUMMARY: An animation from NASA shows the smoke blanketing many parts of Canada and at least a handful of U.S. states
